name: QuVIS
overview: QuVIS, Inc. provides digital motion imaging technology solutions for 3D, digital storage, digital cinema, digital signage, domed cinema, fixed display, government, medical planning, production, post-production, scientific, simulations, synced display, digital image transport, and themed entertainment applications. It offers QuVIS Acuity, an editing and mastering server for production and post-production industries; QuVIS Ovation, a player for fixed displays, including 3D and multi-screen applications, trade shows, museums, theme parks, and entertainment venues; and QuVIS Encore, a production, acquisition, and playback server that records and plays HD and SD in real time. The company also provides QuVIS Cinema Player, a digital cinema server that deliver images to the silver screen; QuVIS Wraptor, a digital cinema mastering plug-in for final cut studio; and QuVIS QDMC that provides a single chip wavelet-based solution for HD recording, playback, and manipulation. In addition, it offers QuVIS QuStudio, a digital rights management software suite for digital cinema content producers and their agents; QuVIS QuShow, a show management system that provides centralized control of digital cinema theatre operations; and QuVIS Cinema System that provides exhibitors a commercial grade platform to address the needs of varying theatrical needs. It offers its products through a network of distributors in the United States and internationally. QuVIS, Inc. was formerly known as Real Video, Inc. The company was founded in 1994 and is based in Topeka, Kansas. On March 20, 2009, an involuntary petition for reorganization under Chapter 11 is filed against QuVIS, Inc. in the US Bankruptcy Court for the District of Kansas.

funding_rounds.source_description: QuVIS, Inc. Receives Funding from Seacoast Capital Partners II, L.P. for Production Ramp.
